title: Monsoon Update тАУ Heavy Rainfall Warning Issued for These States in Next 72 Hours - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update тАУ Heavy Rainfall Warning Issued for These States in Next 72 Hours
vipin kumar
December 03, 2025 - 06:27 AM

Join
Follow
Follow

Share on Media

Facebook
WhatsApp
X
LinkedIn
Telegram

Monsoon Update: The monsoon may have withdrawn, but the rain continues. Many parts of South India are still experiencing rain, causing temperatures to drop. Meanwhile, a severe cold has hit most parts of North India, making it difficult for people to leave their homes.

The next 72 hours are not going to be easy. Rain fell in several parts of Kerala late last night, bringing pleasant weather. Snowfall in Himachal Pradesh has caused temperatures to drop to sub-zero levels in some areas.

Snowfall is also being recorded in states like Uttarakhand and Arunachal Pradesh. The Indian Meteorological Department has issued an alert for heavy rain in various parts of the country. You can find out the weather forecast for specific areas below.

How will the weather be in Kerala?

According to the Meteorological Department, the next 72 hours are not going to be easy for some states. Rain is expected in many areas of Kerala. The International Monetary Fund (IMD) has issued a 72-hour heavy rainfall warning for various areas of Kerala. The IMD has also observed heavy rains in Tamil Nadu.

The rains are continuing in the state. Furthermore, Tamil Nadu may experience another spell of severe weather. Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Puducherry are also likely to experience heavy rains. A torrential rain alert has been issued for Yanam, Rayalaseema, and Mahe for the next 72 hours. People have been urged to exercise caution.

Know the weather in Rajasthan and Delhi.

The IMD has observed a drop in temperatures in Rajasthan and Delhi. There has been no rain since the monsoonтАЩs departure. Severe winter has already set in in both states.

Dense fog continued to engulf some areas of Delhi this morning, reducing visibility and causing difficulties for pedestrians. The cold has also caused shivers in Haryana, Punjab, and western Uttar Pradesh. The temperature level continues to fall here.

title: Monsoon Update тАУ IMD Forecasts Heavy Rain Alert for 6 States Next 48 Hours - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update: The weather is changing across many states. Severe cold has already begun in some states. Meanwhile, the Meteorological Department has predicted another change in the weather in many parts of the country. Several states in North India may experience severe cold. Furthermore, cold and cold waves are also expected in the West and Central India. The IMD predicts severe cold in several states, including Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Bihar, Jharkhand, Madhya Pradesh, and Haryana.

These states may also experience a cold wave. Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and several other states received record rainfall, while Rajasthan and Delhi have already experienced a cold front. The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for heavy rain in several states over the next 48 hours. This rainfall could worsen the cold.

Weather Conditions in Kerala
Kerala is the first state to receive the monsoon, and the state has received significant rainfall. The rains are continuing in Kerala. The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for heavy rain in the next 48 hours, and people have been advised to remain vigilant.

┬аTamil Nadu Weather Forecast

Tamil Nadu also received good rainfall during the monsoon season. Rainfall is continuing in the state. The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for heavy rain for the next 48 hours.

According to the Meteorological Department, rain may continue in several other states, including Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Puducherry, Yanam, Rayalaseema, and Mahe.

Weather Conditions in Delhi

The winter temperature in Delhi may drop further in the coming days. The minimum temperature in Delhi is currently below double digits. The Meteorological Department reported that the minimum temperature in the national capital was recorded at 9.6 degrees Celsius. The maximum temperature is expected to be between 24 and 26 degrees Celsius.

Cold weather is likely to increase in Bihar and Jharkhand.
Severe cold has begun to prevail in many districts of Bihar. The cold wave has further intensified the chill. Every day life has been affected by the chill. The Meteorological Department has issued a cold wave alert for several districts of Bihar, including Araria, Purnia, and Kishanganj. Regarding the weather in Jharkhand, the cold is causing severe discomfort in many areas. Severe cold has already begun in some districts.

Rajasthan Weather Forecast:
Night temperatures have dropped in many parts of Rajasthan. The Meteorological Department predicts a further drop in night temperatures over the next few days. A cold wave is also expected in Jaipur and Bikaner divisions after December 4th.
